title: Memorializing Governor David A. Paterson to proclaim December 11, 2010, as Wreaths Across America Day in the State of New York
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  memorializing  Governor  David  A.  Paterson to
proclaim December 11, 2010, as Wreaths Across America Day in  the  State
of New York

WHEREAS, It is the intent of this Legislative Body to memorialize Gover-
nor  David  A. Paterson to proclaim December 11, 2010, as Wreaths Across
America Day in the State of New York, in conjunction with the  WreathsA-
crossAmerica.org National Campaign; and
  WHEREAS,  Dana L. West High School of Port Byron will be participating
in this auspicious event; this magnificent institution  stands  prepared
to  reach  out,  in  earnest  and  enthusiastic quest of its mission, to
promote the maximum growth of every student, establishing standards  and
building  skills  which  will carry its students and the citizens of its
community into the future; and
  WHEREAS, December 11, 2010, will also mark  the  19th  anniversary  of
Maine  wreaths  being  donated  to  be placed on headstones at Arlington
National Cemetery in Arlington, Virginia; this is also the fifth year of
the national wreath sponsorship campaign under the guidance of the  non-
profit  WreathsAcrossAmerica.org,  which will bring the same remembrance
wreaths to National and State Veterans  cemeteries  in  all  50  states,
veteran monuments, schools, and community centers all across the Nation;
and
  WHEREAS, The Wreaths Across America story began over 19 years ago when
the  Worcester Wreath Company from Harrington, Maine, initiated a tradi-
tion of donating and placing wreaths on the headstones of  our  Nation's
fallen heroes at Arlington National Cemetery; recognition of the service
and  sacrifice of our veterans, and their families, is especially poign-
ant during the traditional holiday season; the purpose is to pay tribute
to those who have served and who have made the ultimate sacrifice; and
  WHEREAS, The Worcester Wreath Company continues to be a major support-
er of the project, donating over 25,000 total wreaths in 2009; in  2010,
it  is  projected  that  over  200,000  wreaths  will be placed, by over
100,000 volunteers as part of the Wreaths  Across  America  mission  to:
Remember, Honor, and Teach; wreaths will be placed in all 50 states from
Maine  to  Alaska  and  Hawaii, and at 24 national cemeteries on foreign
soil; and
  WHEREAS, New York State is very pleased to have  this  opportunity  to
express  its  gratitude  to the men and women of the United States Armed
Forces for their tremendous sacrifices made for our Nation and  for  the
benefit of all Americans; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
memorialize Governor David A. Paterson to proclaim December 11, 2010, as
Wreaths Across America Day in the State of New York; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to The Honorable David A. Paterson, Governor of the State of New
York.
